rules: Rule1: The researcher presents at the conference or the conference is successful.
Rule2: If the researcher collaborates with an organization, then the conference is successful.
Rule3: The researcher collaborates with an organization or the organization funds the research.
Rule4: If the organization funds the research, then the researcher acknowledges the organization.
Rule5: If the researcher acknowledges the organization, then the conference is successful.
Rule6: If the conference is recorded using a device, then the conference streams online.
Rule7: If the conference schedules a session, then the conference broadcasts online.
Rule8: If the conference broadcasts online, then the conference is recorded using a device.
Rule9: If the researcher submits a paper, then the researcher does not present at the conference.
Rule10: The researcher submits a paper or the researcher attends the conference.
Rule11: If the speaker confirms attendance, then the committee invites the speaker.
Rule12: If the speaker prepares a presentation, then the speaker confirms attendance.
Rule13: If the device disrupts the session, then the device does not malfunction.
Rule14: If the conference cancels a session, then the conference does not reschedule a session.
Rule15: If the researcher attends the conference, then the researcher does not present at the conference.
Rule16: If the researcher publishes in a journal, then the paper is cited in a publication.
Rule17: The researcher publishes in a journal or the conference is successful.
Rule18: If the technician repairs the device, then the technician tests the device.
Rule19: If the committee approves the presentation, then, should the technician test the device, the device does not malfunction.

Rule20: If it is not the case that the committee investigates an incident or that the technician testing the device leads to the device not malfunctioning, then the committee penalizes the researcher.
Rule21: If the failure of the conference to be successful does not result in the device disrupting the session, then the conference reschedules a session.
Rule22: If the failure of the conference to be successful does not result in the device disrupting the session, then the conference cancels a session.
Rule23: If the committee does not approve the presentation, then the committee rejects the presentation.
Rule24: If the committee does not approve the presentation, then the speaker prepares a presentation.
Rule25: If the committee does not approve the presentation, then the committee does not reject the presentation.
Rule26: If the committee does not approve the presentation, then the committee does not invite a speaker.
Rule27: If the conference is not successful, then the conference schedules a session.
Rule28: If the conference is not successful, then the device malfunctions.
Rule29: If the conference is not successful, then the technician repairs the device.
facts: Fact1: The conference does not stream online.
Fact2: The committee does not investigate an incident.
Fact3: The committee does not penalize the researcher.
Fact4: The paper is not cited in a publication.
